questions.question: What is the primary purpose of web accessibility?
options: To make websites look visually appealing
To ensure websites can be used by people with disabilities

questions.question: What is the purpose of alt attributes for images?
options: To provide a textual description of the image for screen reader users

questions.question: What should be provided for video content to make it accessible to deaf users?
Which POUR principle addresses the need for text alternatives?
What is the recommended minimum color contrast ratio for normal text according to WCAG AA standards?
Why should you avoid using color alone to convey information?
options: Users with color blindness may miss these cues
Colors are subjective and have different meanings
It makes the design less aesthetically pleasing

questions.question: What is responsive design?
options: Design that responds to user feedback
Design that adapts to different screen sizes and orientations

questions.question: Why should you use relative units (em, rem) instead of fixed pixel sizes?
options: They load faster on mobile devices
They allow text to be resized without breaking the layout

questions.question: Which of these is an example of good keyboard accessibility?
options: Ensuring all interactive elements can be accessed with Tab key

questions.question: What is a keyboard trap?
options: A feature that displays keyboard shortcuts
When users can tab into an element but cannot tab away from it
A lock on physical keyboard access

questions.question: Why is a visible focus indicator important?
options: It makes the website more visually appealing
It helps keyboard users know which element currently has focus
It is required for touch devices

questions.question: Which POUR principle does keyboard accessibility primarily fall under?
Why should users be able to pause, stop, or hide moving content?
options: To help users who have difficulty tracking moving objects

questions.question: Which users might need more time to complete tasks on a website?
Why should you specify the primary language of a webpage?
options: To rank higher in search engines
To help screen readers pronounce content correctly

questions.question: What is the benefit of using clear, simple language on your website?
options: It reduces the amount of content needed
It makes the content accessible to a wider audience including those with cognitive disabilities
It makes the design look more professional

questions.question: Why is consistent navigation important for accessibility?
options: It makes the website visually consistent
It helps users predict where to find navigation elements

questions.question: What does predictable interaction mean?
options: All users will interact with the site in the same way
Components with the same functionality look and behave consistently
The website can predict user behavior
Users need to learn how to use the site before visiting

questions.question: What is the benefit of providing clear error messages?
options: Users understand what went wrong and how to fix it
It prevents users from submitting forms

questions.question: Why should form fields have clear labels?
options: To help all users, including those using screen readers, understand what information is required
To comply with data protection laws

questions.question: Why is using valid, well-formed HTML important?
options: It makes the code more readable
It ensures compatibility with current and future browsers and assistive technologies

questions.question: What does 'name, role, value' refer to in accessibility?
options: Properties of interface components that can be programmatically determined

questions.question: Why should status changes be communicated to assistive technologies?
options: To avoid disrupting the user's current focus while keeping them informed
It's not necessary to communicate status changes

questions.question: What is progressive enhancement?
options: Gradually adding new features over time
A layered approach that provides a basic experience to all users, then enhances for more capable browsers/devices

questions.question: Why should you test across different platforms and assistive technologies?
options: To increase your website's market share
To ensure broad compatibility and accessibility
To identify the most popular devices
It's only necessary for government websites

questions.question: Which POUR principle is most concerned with ensuring websites work with current and future technologies?
